title: Postinfarction ventricular septal defect associated with long-term steroid therapy.
abst: Two cases of postinfarction ventricular septal rupture in patients on long-term steroid therapy are presented and the favourable outcome in both cases described. A possible association between steroid therapy and subsequent postinfarction septal rupture is discussed.
title_plus_abst: Postinfarction ventricular septal defect associated with long-term steroid therapy. Two cases of postinfarction ventricular septal rupture in patients on long-term steroid therapy are presented and the favourable outcome in both cases described. A possible association between steroid therapy and subsequent postinfarction septal rupture is discussed.
split_sentence: Postinfarction ventricular septal defect associated with long-term steroid therapy.
Two cases of postinfarction ventricular septal rupture in patients on long-term steroid therapy are presented and the favourable outcome in both cases described.
A possible association between steroid therapy and subsequent postinfarction septal rupture is discussed.
